If you're in the mood for a classic, I highly recommend "True Grit" (1968) starring Jeff Bridges as Rooster Cogburn - his performance is absolutely iconic. Or, if you'd prefer something a bit more modern with a twist, "Forsaken" (2015) might be up your alley, featuring Landon Liboiron and Demi Moore in a reimagined take on Macbeth set in the Wild West.

I think you'd really enjoy "The Newton Boys"! It's a fun and lighthearted Western that tells the story of a gang of bank robbers who are known for their good planning and minimal violence. With a star-studded cast including Matthew McConaughey, Tom Sizemore, and Dwight Yoakam, it's a great choice if you're looking for a entertaining Western with a unique plot.

Or, if you're in the mood for something a bit more intense, "The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford" is a thought-provoking film that explores the complexities of fame and loyalty through the story of Jesse James' assassination. With an all-star cast including Brad Pitt and Casey Affleck, it's a great choice if you're looking for a Western with strong characters and a gripping storyline.

I think I have just the movie for you! Considering your interest in war movies, I highly recommend "Black Hawk Down" (2001). It's a intense and gripping film that follows the true story of US soldiers during the Somali Civil War. The all-star cast brings this powerful story to life, and it's an absolute must-see for anyone interested in war dramas.

If you're looking for something a bit lighter, "Tropic Thunder" (2008) is a hilarious spoof of war movies that's sure to make you laugh. With a talented comedic cast, including Ben Stiller, Robert Downey Jr., and Jack Black, this movie will have you chuckling throughout.
